message_2:
To simplify the rational expression (4x^2 - 8x) / (2x^2 - 6x), we can first factor out the common factors in both the numerator and the denominator.

Numerator: 4x^2 - 8x = 4x(x - 2)
Denominator: 2x^2 - 6x = 2x(x - 3)

Now, the rational expression becomes:

(4x(x - 2)) / (2x(x - 3))

Next, we can simplify by dividing both the numerator and the denominator by their greatest common divisor (GCD), which is 2x in this case:

(4x(x - 2)) / (2x(x - 3)) = (2 * 2x(x - 2)) / (2 * x(x - 3))

Divide both the numerator and the denominator by 2x:

(2 * 2x(x - 2)) / (2 * x(x - 3)) = 2(x - 2) / (x - 3)

The simplified rational expression is:

2(x - 2) / (x - 3)
